fact_check_explanation_title: Andrew Bridgen wrong to call mRNA vaccines gene therapy
fact_check_explanation_summary: Gene therapy has a specific definition which does not include the mRNA vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Nothing has been ‘added’ to the children’s flu vaccine to cause strep A
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims something’s been added to the nasal flu mist to make children sick. This is false.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Cor ona virus’ doesn’t mean ‘heart attack virus’ in Latin
fact_check_explanation_summary: A screenshot from Google Translate appears to show the translation, but this isn’t the meaning of the words in Latin.

fact_check_explanation_title: The World Economic Forum has not called for paedophilia to be decriminalised
fact_check_explanation_summary: Quotes attributed to the WEF and its co-founder Klaus Schwab circulating on Facebook have been denied by a WEF spokesperson.

fact_check_explanation_title: UN soldiers are not forcing the unvaccinated into camps
fact_check_explanation_summary: The claim is being made on Facebook but there is no evidence it is happening.

fact_check_explanation_title: Cat injured in Middlesbrough is really a viral 2018 picture from California
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims the cat was hurt and picked up earlier this year.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid death rates were not a ‘lie’
fact_check_explanation_summary: While different measures of death rates have their own strengths and limitations, they all broadly concur that, in the UK, sadly, around 200,000 people have died of Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: Sodium bicarbonate is not ‘lethal’ to all cancers
fact_check_explanation_summary: because there’s no evidence sodium bicarbonate can be used to cure cancer. Some studies have looked at its use in reducing tumour pH levels, but none have suggested it could …

fact_check_explanation_title: Campervan shared in Facebook post not part of so-called giveaway
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post offering a camper van to one lucky winner isn’t quite what it seems.

fact_check_explanation_title: Westminster does not control the amount Scotland spends on its NHS
fact_check_explanation_summary: Although Scotland receives funds from the UK Government, it can spend them on any devolved services.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claim about vaccine deaths wasn’t ‘discussed in House of Commons’
fact_check_explanation_summary: A claim that daily vaccine deaths were higher than Covid-19 deaths was not discussed in the House of Commons.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mask mandates did not immediately control a Covid-19 wave in 2020
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is evidence that masks work to reduce the spread of Covid-19, but making them compulsory did not reverse a wave in the summer of 2020.
